content:
Hi @praveen cognizant ,
since you are new you can continue here

/home/zulip/deployments/current/manage.py generate_realm_creation_link
above command has worked fine and given the below output

Please visit the following secure single-use link to register your
new Zulip organization:

https://164ubuntuhost.local/create_realm/89f80e1dce81c47ff69849d32a47706ded7f3577

but the link above when i try open on chrome browser is not working
it's not a valid hostname, update the hostname of your server to match the DNS record for its IP address

you can add 164ubuntuhost.local to your /etc/hosts (or equivalent) if you're just testing.
Changing hostname after zulip is installed is one of the things that breaks the rabbitmq service.
I'd consider re-deploying after setting up the server properly.

i guess you mean instead of hostname give IP address, i have tried even with that too
but still it is not working
i have just check the rabbitmq service health, it look good to me, I am not finding any issue with rabbitmq
If you run the hostname command on your server, does it say 164ubuntuhost.local or something else?

I'd expect to use a name like zulip.example.com though you can use whatever you like.
Also, have you created and installed the SSL certificate files?
pasted image
example.com is just an example, you need to use your own domain name
I have modified the Access-Control-Allow-Headers to allow for custom headers

But I am still getting the same error
isskkapi is not allowed in header
after making the changes to api_headers file. I even restarted the server
@kumarmo2 This got resolved after the zulip-puppet-apply suggestion?
@Mateusz Mandera . Yep it did

Hi everyone, i try to install zulip in my server running Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS Bionicfor the first time, when i launch the script i got this error !

django.db.utils.DataError: character with byte sequence 0xe2 0x80 0x99 in encoding "UTF8" has no equivalent in encoding "LATIN1"
CONTEXT:  line 4 of configuration file "/usr/share/postgresql/10/tsearch_data/en_us.affix"


Zulip installation failed (exit code 1)!

The install process is designed to be idempotent, so you can retry after resolving whatever issue caused the failure (there should be a traceback above). A log of this installation is available in /var/log/zulip/install.log

It looks like your database user is running in LATIN1 encoding, which I believe isn't something Django is designed for.
While this isn't Zulip (or even Ubuntu) specific, it does give the way to change client encoding to the UTF8 listed in the error: https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-use-postgresql-with-your-django-application-on-centos-7

I suspect you'll need the command that sets client_encoding, but modified for your zulip database user:
ALTER ROLE myprojectuser SET client_encoding TO 'utf8';
